column4: Hi, can someone help me fix my time and date? I did something to mess it up when I first started using Ubuntu and now i'm paying the price for it.
I just did, but noone said anything
see that /etc/timezone points to your correct location
Can you show me how to do that on the terminal?
I set it to America/Mexico_City, which should be -6, i think
does it point to your location? if it is then your computer should show the correct time
Yeah, it points to my location, but my computer is showing the wrong time
I'm sure the ntpdate function in /etc/network/if-up.d should take care of your time setup while ubuntu boots
I don't understand what that is
everytime ubuntu starts, ntpdate shell script got executed to connect your computer to an ntp server, to synchronize your computer's cleck setting
Do I cahnge NTPSERVERS="ntp.ubuntu.com" to NTPSERVERS="ntp.ubuntu.com pool.ntp.org"
